newsitem.title: UK: Hanson statement re U.S. discount notes.
newsitem.headline: Hanson statement re U.S. discount notes.

text.p: Hanson America Inc. said on Wednesday that it has started a consent solicitation on behalf of itself and Hanson PLC in respect of its 2.39 per cent Senior Exchangeable Discount Notes due 2001 to amend certain covenants relating to the Notes and the ADS rights attached in connection with the proposed demergers of the chemicals, tobacco and energy businesses of Hanson PLC.

If valid consents are received in respect of Notes representing at least a majority of the amount outstanding and not revoked by 1700 New York City time, on Wednesday, September 18 (unless otherwise extended), and the other conditions to the consent solicitation are satisfied or waived, holders who have delivered such consents will receive $1.25 for each $1,000 principal amount due at maturity of the Notes.

Hanson America reserves the right to extend, amend, abandon or terminate the consent solicitation whether or not the requisite consents have been received. Pursuant to the demerger of the chemicals businesses, Millennium Chemicals Inc., a newly formed corporation, will become the parent of Hanson America (to be renamed Millennium America).

After the Millennium Chemicals demerger occurs, Millennium America will notify Noteholders that it will repurchase for 101% of the accreted value of the Notes, plus accrued interest, any and all Notes properly tendered pursuant to the change in control provision of the Notes.

Questions regarding the solicitation should be directed to Salomon Brothers Inc. at (001 212) 783 3738 in New York or Goldman Sachs & Co. at (001 212) 902 8377 in New York, the joint solicitation agents. Requests for copies of the solicitation materials should be directed to Georgeson & Company, Inc., the information agent, at (001 212) 440 9800 in New York or (0171) 454 7100 in London.
